data.author: Brian Grissom

changelog.release_notes:
- layout adjustments (trying to make it easier to read)
- Rep counter (it's not perfect, it's based on change in direction)

Up Next:
- more layout adjustments (multi-use icons, bigger text)
- algorithm refinement (trying to weed out extraneous movement and improve rep counter)
- code cleanup (it's a mess right now)

- Added a configuration page
---Configure which wrist you're wearing it on, which access, setup and lift times!
-Some minor visual changes
-Tweaked the algorithm some, still working on some kinks!

- added some color
- adjusted calculations
- adjusted layout and fonts

Version 1.0
- simple black and white
- start/restart button

Next Update:
- colors
- custom timers

data.description:
Are you trying to improve or track your bar speed? This is your app!

BarSpeed is a simple, no frills app that turns your Pebble watch into a velocity-measurement device. Simply start the app and press the start button. At the end of your set BarSpeed will display performance data.

Note: This app does not use an advanced scientific model but is more than accurate enough for most of us. Why pay $150+ for a separate workout device when you already have one on your wrist?

From the Developer: This is a pet project for myself, which is why it's free. I'm hoping to add a companion app with tracking and graphing, but right now it's a side project.
I'm 100% available for feedback and will do my best to support your needs.
